items.title: Java Developer (100% Remote in France or Germany) at PeopleDoc (Paris, France) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: HR Services, SaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Description/ Job Summary:

PeopleDoc is looking for experienced and talented developers who love working with microservice architecture built on top of a Lot of Java/Dropwizard & more and more Scala/Play. PeopleDoc has been growing like crazy during the last 4 years, and hopefully it’s not going to stop! The R&D teams is always in the process of improving our application for our users and supporting the incredible growth of PeopleDoc.

 In this role, you will work closely with product owners, UX developers, SRE, DBAs, Support teams, and other web engineers to push forward the implementation of new features while also helping us to scale our platform. As a member of one of our feature teams, you will join a friendly and talented group of Java developers, within a dynamic, forward looking company, facing great engineering challenges.

Our stack includes: Java, Scala, PlayFramework, Python/Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ, Ansible, ember.js

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Design, ship and test new features in collaboration with the Product Team
  • Use your deep understanding of web technologies and APIs to advise on the system's architecture
  • Push your code in production, improve our deployment process and monitor it
  • Analyze, rethink and refactor the code to scale the application
  • Write unit, functional and performances tests
  • Contribute to our OpenSource Projects

Skills & Requirements

Competencies required:

  • The ability to write tested, production grade Java 8 code
  • Extensive SQL skills
  • A solid understanding of Linux development and automation tools (we use Ansible to manage configuration, and you are expected to deploy your own application and features)
  • Like to learn & share, you are passionate and humble about your skills
  • Be user focused – ultimately, we are are working for our users
  • Excellent communication skills. As a team and “international company” we communicate mostly in English, but R&D is based in Paris, so French is mandatory
  • Computer Science degree is viewed favorably

About PeopleDoc

Here are PeopleDoc, we believe that employees should receive the same level of services as the company’s best customers. Our unique “state of the art” HR Service Delivery platform provides HR teams with the tools they need to provide a great services while considerably decreasing the manual work behind the scenes and allowing companies to go paperless in their administration.

The PeopleDoc HR Service Delivery platform helps HR teams more easily answer employee requests on demand, automate employee processes, and manage compliance across multiple locations. Our cloud solutions include case management, process automation and employee file management. 100% software as a service, PeopleDoc solutions integrate with existing HR systems, can be implemented in 8-12 weeks, and are designed for agile ongoing use by HR teams serving diverse workforces. PeopleDoc serves more than 500 clients with employees in 165 countries in nine languages with a 100% customer retention rate. More information is available at http://www.people-doc.com.  ;

Our solutions:

  • HR Service Delivery platform
  • Employee File Management
  • Case Management & Employee Portal with personalized knowledge base
  • Process Automation
  • Advanced Analytics

Benefits

Great equipment (choice of Mac or Lenovo)
Employee Stock Option Plan
Flex Office
Allowance for Training/Seminars
Health Plan
New Office located in the heart of Paris
Generous Vacation Plan (25 vacation + 10 RTT)
Subsidized Meal Tickets
Subsidized Commuting

items.title: Front-end Developer (UK) at Surevine (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Cybersecurity
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

MUST BE BASED IN UK

We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.

Skills and experience

Essential

  • Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 2 years experience
  • Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies
  • A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, WebSockets, etc.
  • Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum
  • Working knowledge of coding best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation
  • Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment

Desirable

  • Web application user interface design skills and experience
  • Experience using Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and AWS tools and services
  • An understanding of application security and secure coding practices
  • Demonstrable passion for working with Open standards / Open Source experience

Responsibilities

  • Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery
  • Work as an integral member of a small and remote team
  • Agree and deliver on sprint commitments
  • Design and implement secure software components
  • Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases
  • Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality
  • Participate in peer review processes
  • Supporting the team through the full release cycle
  • Participate in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations
  • Supporting the test team where automation is necessary
  • To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes

About Surevine

Surevine builds secure, scalable collaboration solutions for the most security conscious organisations; joining people up and enabling collaboration on their most sensitive information. Our systems are accredited to handle the most sensitive information, whilst still delivering an intuitive and engaging user experience which actively promotes participation; building smart, secure networks of connected people. Our own smart research and development and customer sponsored R&D into collaboration technology delivers constant innovation, building products born out of genuine user needs.

Reasons to join

  • Opportunity to work amongst a team of exceptional developers working on and with the latest technologies
  • Be part of an agile, delivery-focussed team with daily stand-ups, fortnightly sprints, and retrospectives
  • Our belief in self-managed teams and reliance on self-motivated people
  • Our Director’s aren’t hidden away. They are accessible and involved. They are our co-workers
  • Chance to work in an fast-moving innovative environment with some tough problems for you to help us solve
  • Everyone is provided with a budget to kit out their workspace and make it cooler and more productive than they would ever get in a corporate cube
  • We don’t wear suits (often)

Benefits

Flexible working hours
Exceptional developers working on and with the latest technologies
Hubs for co-working
Generous budget to kit out your workspace (beats a corporate cube)
We don't wear suits
Agile, delivery-focussed team with daily stand-ups, sprints and retros
Beers on the Directors (if The Smiths are playing)
23+ days holiday
Shiny kit

items.title: Azure Function .Net Engineer at Gig Economy Group () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Social Commerce
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

It's simple. We want a C# .Net Engineer with backend experience to work on our Azure function platform and APIM development. If you don't know what that is, or don't find that prospect exciting, we are probably not a fit for you.

On the other hand, you get to master the 'serverless' world that will displace all those docker and kubernetes experts--or hedge your career bets if you already are one. 

We are a lean startup. If you don't know what that is, read  "Lean Startup". Then come back here, where you'll get to build a core team of very smart and talented people solving very difficult problems. 

We work on Slack and Zoom. If that makes you uncomfortable, then stay in your comfort zone and don't apply.

But you won't have to commute, or relocate, away from friends and family, to a place you cannot afford to live.

We just delivered Beta 1 Preview. It was rough. Phase 1 delivers in February. It's going to be a bumpy ride.

No way to sugarcoat that. We'll be moving fast fast fast.

But then we move on to a second phase that incorporates machine learning and sociographic information to transform local economies.

In short, this is a position at the leading edge of software services engineering skillsets.

If you read this far, you should probably apply and see if we are a match. 

This a contract-to-hire job.

Relevant Skills the Might Convince Us:

  1. C# and Visual Studio a must.
  2. Swagger or other tools for building APIs
  3. Azure Functions
  4. Azure API Management
  5. Neo4j, Cypher, multi-node, enterprise deployments a plus
  6. Twilio api experience a plus.
  7. A marked propensity to Google it first and ask questions later.

About Gig Economy Group

GEG is building a social commerce platform, revolutionizing an industry that hasn't yet been transformed by digitization. We're a well-funded startup with our first commercial customer. Join us to change local economies for the better.

Benefits

Focused
Remote work
90% distributed team
Fresh turf. No legacy code.
(Mostly) serverless back end stack

items.title: C++ expert; web crawling or web API experience strongly preferred at Core Data () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Big Data, Developer APIs, Sports betting odds algorithms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Core Data has an opening for two (2) experienced senior-level C++ programmers to add to our EU-based remote work team.  This work-from-home contract style position offers a full time opportunity to each developer selected for the position.  Candidates selected for this position will work under a full-time independent contractor relationship with our EU-based division.

C++ is the main programming language used on company projects; however, candidates are expected to be "full stack" and have experience in web APIs, web services, JSON, etc, since nearly all of our in-house applications either produce or consume web services.  Many of the services we interact with are undocumented or legacy code, so patience and investigative skills to determine how a given remote API works and how to extract the needed information from it are of the highest importance.  Many projects will involve creation of web bots, crawlers, or automatic web scraping programs to gather data from specified sites or endpoints.

For this position, emphasis is placed on the applicant's ability to produce solutions with minimal outside help.  As this is a senior-level position, all applicants are expected to be able to write the required applications from start to finish, including design of any database queries or tables.  Design specifications will be provided for each project prior to commencement.  While actual programming ability is one of the key requirements of this position, applicants for this senior-level posting are expected to show initiative and take a practical approach towards solving real-world problems.

Most of the applications developed at Core Data are related to data feeds for sports odds, betting, and statistics.

About Core Data

Core Data is a data and statistics provider with an emphasis on low-latency, real-time sports data feeds. Core Data's product lineup is the backbone of a variety of innovative products, including live score trackers, play by play game trackers, and real-time AI-based odds. The company's statistics database includes detailed play by play records for past matchups across 22 sports. Additionally, Core Data's low-latency real-time data feeds offer live coverage on over 18,000 events monthly. The company offers a variety of pricing structures, ranging from starter plans that allow clients to choose events on a pay-as-you-go basis to comprehensive monthly packages that include all major leagues and sports.

Benefits

Monthly paid time off
Competitive Compensation
Flexible hours / work schedules

items.title: Senior software engineer (C++) at Sticker Mule () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: eCommerce, Manufacturing
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

What you'll do:

1. Build, test, install and maintain software to automate our manufacturing processes.

2. Continually seek ways to optimize those processes.

3. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team’s code style guidelines.

4. Work to improve and maintain the code health of all our software.

5. Collaborate with other developers, team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we’re always building the optimal solution.

6. Participate in peer code reviews.

About you:

1. You have a minimum of 3 years professional software development experience.

2. You’re highly competent in multiple general purpose languages. C++ and Ruby would be especially beneficial.

3. You’re confident in mathematics relevant to computer graphics.

4. Experience with the following would be highly beneficial.

5. Printing and related issues like color management.

6. Vector and raster graphics generation and manipulation.

7. You are experienced in using and building web services.

8. You possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills.

9. You have great written and verbal communication skills in English.

Requirements:

1. Applicants must reside in the US.

2. This position requires periodic visits to our manufacturing facilities in upstate NY.

3. Special consideration for applicants on or near the East coast.

4. Applicants will be sent a Hackerrank test within 1-2 business days of applying.

5. Test must be completed within 5 business days.

Apply here only:

https://www.stickermule.com/jobs?job=df523075-edca-4b4c-9d6c-984502a600cc&title=senior-software…

About Sticker Mule

Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable and powered by an outstanding remote team that supports the growth of our manufacturing operations. We aim to build one of the Internet’s best technical teams. Currently, our development team operates in 8 countries and we’re always looking for more exceptional developers to join us.

Why we enjoy working here

1. We work flexible hours with an asynchronous culture.

2. We work at a sustainable pace without unreasonable external deadlines.

3. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on.

4. Opportunities to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team.

What we look for https://www.stickermule.com/blog/characteristics-we-look-for-in-team-members

Benefits

Flexible hours with asynchronous culture.
Sustainable work pace without unreasonable expectations or deadlines.
Varied, interesting technical challenges.
Opportunities to make a large impact as a small team.

items.title: Software Engineer in Test at Carbon Black (Portland, OR) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Cybersecurity, Information Technology
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

Why Carbon Black?

At Carbon Black, you’ll have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats. If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for three consecutive years. Join us!

Why You Matter

We at Carbon Black are seeking a highly technical continuous learner to fill a critical SDET position. In this role, you will work closely with developers to build out and maintain automation infrastructure as well as contribute in active ways to the test automation and product code. You will have the opportunity to work actively as part of an agile team focused on the world’s leading network endpoint security solutions, and gain exposure to cutting edge technology.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop and maintain test infrastructure and supporting libraries and contribute to system, API, and component automated tests
  • Integrate automation into the build system
  • Assist in automation adoption within engineering organization
  • Work with developers on improving the system quality (during design and implementation phases)
  • Assist where needed on other development tasks as a member of the Scrum team

What You’ll Bring

  • Strong programming skills in Python (with C/C++ experience also preferred)
  • Strong track record of exploring and implementing new technologies and specializing in multiple technical disciplines
  • Experience with VMWare, VSphere, and Vagrant
  • Experience with Jenkins, including Pipelines and other more advanced features
  • Solid understanding of core Quality Engineering principles and best practices
  • Solid experience with the software development cycle, including common tools (e.g.  Jira, git, SVN, etc.)
  • Ability to function well in an Agile development team, with a functional knowledge of Agile Scrum methodology
  • Experience with AWS

Preferred:

  • BS in Computer Science or related discipline
  • 3-5 years’ experience working in a Quality Engineering role, with a strong level of exposure to implementing, improving, and maintaining test infrastructure
  • 2+ years’ experience writing either production code or extensive automation code for distributed enterprise products in a professional context
  • 2+ years’ experience working with and configuring Jenkins, Team City or other similar CI tools
  • Kernel driver or other deeper programming exposure or experience
  • Experience with cyber security

About Carbon Black

Who We Are

Carbon Black is the leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black’s Next-Generation Antivirus (NGAV) solution, Cb Defense, leverages breakthrough prevention technology, “Streaming Prevention,” to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. Cb Defense uniquely combines breakthrough prevention with market-leading detection and response into a single, lightweight agent delivered through the cloud. With more than 7 million endpoints under management, Carbon Black has more than 2,500 customers, including 30 of the Fortune 100. These customers use Carbon Black to replace legacy antivirus, lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and protect their endpoints from the most advanced cyberattacks, including non-malware attacks.

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company. 

Benefits

Flexible vacation
Remote/Work-from-home options
Medical/Dental/Vision
Stand-up desks and unique workspaces
Free snacks/drinks, Happy Hours, and regular catering
Care.com access and pet insurance
On-site gym
Career development programs
Lounge/game room
Competitive salaries, 401k, and stock options

items.title: Java Developer at APEX Expert Solutions (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Big Data, Government, Military
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Work in an fast-paced agile development environment architecting and developing Hadoop applications
  • Provide technology recommendations for potential product application development
  • Gather and analyze requirements from product owners ensuring products meet business requirements
  • Collaborate with other software engineers and team leads in designing and developing software solutions which meet high quality standards
  • Quickly prototype and develop Python/Java/Scala applications in diverse operating environments capable of interfacing with NoSQL datastores such as Accumulo and HBase
  • Write efficient code to extract, transform, load, and query very large datasets to include both structured and unstructured datasets
  • Develop standards and new design patterns for Big Data applications and master the tools and technology components within the Hadoop and Cloudera environments
  • Design and implement REST API applications provide web application connectivity to backend datastores

Skills & Requirements

  • 3 years of building Java applications including framework experience (J2EE, Spring, etc.)
  • Experience using traditional ETL tools & RDBMS
  • Experience developing REST web services
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies
  • Demonstrated effective and successful verbal and written communication skills
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related technological degree
  • U.S. citizen

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience building and coding applications using Hadoop components – HDFS, HBase, Hive, Sqoop, Flume, Spark, etc
  • Experience building and maintaining Cloudera-based clusters
  • Full life cycle software application development experience
  • Experience with unstructured datasets, such as log files, email, text
  • Experience with geospatial datasets and datastores

About APEX Expert Solutions

APEX Expert Solutions delivers analytic services, technologies, and training curriculum in support of Department of Defense customers. APEX tightly couples analysts, engineers, and trainers to bring mission success.

APEX Benefits include 401k with employer matching, 15-days Paid Time Off annually plus 10 Federal Holidays, Tuition Reimbursement, Healthcare, Dental, and Vision.

Benefits

Vacations and holidays off
Cutting edge technology
Fantastic medical, dental and vision insurance
Work from home options
Social activities and events
Competitive salary and bonuses
Business casual attire
Collaborative environment

items.title: VB.NET Software Engineer at CenterEdge Software (Roxboro, NC) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Recreation & Leisure, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

VB.NET Software Engineer

Job Description

Do you thrive on creating software that matters? Are you passionate about your craft and enjoy working with others who feel the same?

As an innovator in the operation of family entertainment centers, we are looking for experienced VB.NET developers who would love to join an established team focused on delivering serious software for a fun business.

Requirements & Skills

  • Experience developing desktop applications using VB.NET and WinForms.
  • Experience with Entity Framework.
  • Experience with MS SQL Server.
  • Must possess a firm grasp of Object-Oriented Principles.
  • Some experience working with REST API's and/or SOAP WCF.
  • Bonus:  experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
  • Bonus:  prior experience with Infragistics.
  • Bonus:  prior experience developing with C#.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 5 years experience designing and implementing desktop-based software systems.
  • Authorized to work in the U.S. without a visa or other sponsorship.

Cultural Fit

  • You have a passion for writing great code with the desire to achieve and exceed goals.
  • You are personally accountable for your work and love creating value for your users.
  • You have a desire for the team to succeed above personal preferences.
  • You are extremely technical, but also have a passion to constantly learn and develop new skills.

This position offers the opportunity to work remotely up to 80% of the time, but candidates MUST reside within a reasonable drive of our business location in Roxboro, NC. 

Must be authorized to work in the United States; candidates requiring Visa sponsorship WILL NOT be considered.

Must be willing to undergo a pre-employment background check and drug screen, in accordance with local law/regulations.

About CenterEdge Software

CenterEdge Software has been redefining the successful operation of family entertainment centers, trampoline parks, water parks, museums, roller skating rinks, and large-scale amusement parks across the country since 2004. We deliver real-world solutions to meet the everyday needs of facility owners and managers. The CenterEdge product suites offer solutions for point of sale, online sales and reservations, labor management, capacity scheduling, food and beverage sales, attractions management, and mobile transactions.

Benefits

Fun Work Environment

items.title: Write quality code that scales as our new backend dev at Savvii Managed WordPress Hosting (Nijmegen, Netherlands) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer, System Administrator
Industry: Cloud Services, Network Engineering, Web Hosting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Do words like GIT, Ruby, AMQP, Docker, PHP, Composer, PHP unit and Redis make your developer heart beat faster? Do these technologies hold few secrets for you and are you capable of converting ideas into working and secure applications? If so, then we want to meet you.

We are looking for a creative developer to develop and maintain our back-end systems and web applications. In this position, you will work as part of a professional and enthusiastic team on optimising and developing our REST API, provisioning tools, client portals, ordering systems and other (web-based) applications.

Who are you?

  • Minimum higher vocational education (HBO) work and thinking level, with relevant work experience.
  • You are fluent in either PHP or Ruby and are willing to study other languages. Knowledge of Linux and WordPress is a prerequisite
  • Familiar with current (web) technologies such as Docker, Elasticsearch, Rails or AMQP. Knowledge of testing frameworks and deployment strategies.
  • A team player: Curious, enterprising and creative.

Job description

  • As a member of a team, you will work on automation, features and maintenance for a hosting platform with which we serve thousands of clients
  • You will work using Scrum tools to improve our platform in an agile manner
  • You believe in as much automation of processes as possible to ensure the highest possible level of uniformity and quality across the entire hosting platform
  • You can serve as a technical consultant for both internal departments and clients

You and Savvii

Starting on your first day at the company, you will be an essential part of a professional team. Your future? You will shape your own future by continuously developing yourself and by proactively seizing opportunities. We believe that your added value is greatest if you enjoy your work. We consider personal development, responsibility and substantial challenges to be essential to ensure the enjoyment of the work. Because we give you the space to utilize your talents to their full extent and through the sparring opportunities with skilled colleagues, you will continually work on your own development.

What makes it attractive for you to work for us?

  • Competitive salary that grows in tandem with your ambition
  • Informal work environment in a modern building equipped with lounge and roof terrace or a remote position
  • New Macbook Pro or Dell XPS laptop to enable you to work smoothly
  • Challenging work with your own responsibilities and growth potential
  • Training opportunities
  • Time to visit conferences
  • Time to contribute to Open Source
  • Time to experiment with new web technologies, such as in the form of hackathons
  • 100% travel allowance when travelling by public transport
  • Supplemental: chair massage by a real professional, company fitness programme, free fruit and media library

About Savvii Managed WordPress Hosting

About your team

Our dev team consists of 4 developers based in Nijmegen. We are also open to remote colleagues. Will you be the first of many new colleagues?

We believe in trying lots of new things, but in a way that is stable and scales across thousands of sites and servers. Things like TDD, (internal) penetration tests, code reviews and CI are our way of guaranteeing code quality.

There is room to contribute to Open Source projects, visit conferences and enhance your public speaking skills.

We are working with SCRUM, the team has either control about scope or planning.

What unites us is a love of games, tinkering with computers and electronics and throwing the occasional LAN or VR party at the office.

About Savvii

Savvii is the Managed WordPress host in Europe. Only hosting, only WordPress. Full stop.

This focus enables us to offer our clients the best hosting. We innovate continuously in the area of speed, scalability, security and convenience.

Our company is made up of young people with a passion for technology, gadgets and the latest developments on the Internet. As an organisation, we place a high value on commitment and we ensure that you can demonstrate an entrepreneurial character. At our company, you are allowed to make mistakes. We are open about that: internally and towards our clients. We also believe in sharing: for example, we organise the WordPress meet-up Nijmegen, sponsor and organise WordCamps and we also speak at WordCamps and other conferences.

Are you the candidate that we’re looking for? If so, don’t wait any longer and apply. A Certificate of Good Behaviour [Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag] will also be required as part of the application procedure.

For more information, please contact Lisa Nellestijn, our HR advisor, at +31(0)24-3605040. Of course, you can always stop by for a cup of coffee or tea to get an impression of the pleasant working atmosphere.

Benefits

Chair Massage
Free fruit
Remote working
MacBook Pro's
Contribution to your sports and excercise costs
Attending conferences
Contributing to Open Source initiatives

items.title: ManageFlitter / ManageSocial : Senior Node.js / React Developer
items.content:
Senior Node.js / React Developer

Posted Nov 9

ManageFlitter / ManageSocial
Headquarters: Sydney Australia
https://manageflitter.com/careers

DESCRIPTION

ManageFlitter – http://ManageFlitter.com – is a multi-award winning SaaS social media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

Our new product http://ManageSocial.com is well into development (we are very close to private alpha release). You can get a sneak peak of a very early version of ManageSocial here -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W2oABEOCdpo&featur... 

This is a unique opportunity to work on an interesting greenfield project. Initially you will be working with 1 mid-weight engineer , 1 UI designer, and a tech lead to take this product from alpha to launch and beyond. You will also be working directly with the CEO.

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney with team members in Canada, Brazil, Ukraine & Russia. We are approximately 50% remote based.

We believe Social Media is changing the world and we love being part of the change.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a preference for working with a small smart team to work with us on our new ManageSocial product.

Whilst this is a remote friendly role our headquarters are based in Sydney Australia - time crossover is required with the team in Sydney and team members in other parts of the world. Depending on your location this may require you to time shift to some degree. 

Team is everything and we are proud of the great ManageFlitter and ManageSocial team that we have built. To ensure that the team remains of a very high standard we follow a fairly rigorous hiring process:

  • Initial 10-20 minute Skype chat.
  • Technical task: a custom designed technical task that allows us to gain insight into your approach to solving technical problems: 2-4 hours for someone familiar with our stack.
  • Technical interview: in depth technical chat based on your technical task: 1-2 hours.
  • Skype chat with 1-2 additional team members - 1 hour.

REQUIREMENTS


  • Impeccable English communication skills.
  • 5+ years experience building APIs preferably with Node.js, Express.js / Koa.js or similar.
  • Strong literacy with ES6 features and stay up to date with standards using babel.
  • Experience working with TDD including writing unit, integration & functional tests.
  • Experience working with BDD.
  • Experience delivering responsive UX/UI.
  • Understands Websockets and using Redis pub/sub model for real time communication with clients.
  • Previously worked on development of products using a SQL storage backend.
  • Experience building SPAs using React.
  • Experience working with AWS cloud services including Lambda.
  • Experience working with Postgres at scale.
  • Has built an application implementing the following:
    Redux
    Redux Sagas
    Reselect
    React Router
    ImmutableJS
    PostCSS
  • Experience working in an agile environment with a working knowledge of scrum and kanban workflows.
  • Relevant tertiary education.



BONUS SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Product flair.
  • Strong working knowledge of the Twitter and Instagram API.
  • Experience writing technical specifications and documentation.
  • Has contributed to open source projects (provide examples if available).
  • Experience leading technical teams.

BENEFITS

Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and productive team.

We are committed to creating a culture where every team member can do their best work.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We would love to hear from you.

Apply for this position

Please apply at the following url:https://manageflitter.workable.com/jobs/544542

items.content:
Software Engineer - Jobmote

Software Engineer

Pressable

Pressable, a leading provider of WordPress hosting, is looking for a talented developer to help us build the world's best WordPress hosting service.

We are looking for these qualities:

  • Experience using Ruby on Rails in conjunction with an underlying database like MySQL or similar
  • Advanced proficiency with at least one scripting language like PHP or Python. Low-level language experience is a plus
  • Experience in Ansible configuration management
  • Ability to handle all phases of a project on your own, from idea to implementation.
  • Ability to create awesome developer documentation around features and configurations for team members and users
  • Self directed with strong organizational skills
  • Teamwork: sharing your expertise with our team and collaborating with stakeholders.
  • Leadership skills with experience managing engineers at past positions

Bonus if you have:

  • Experience with web developmen
  • Experience with web development frameworks
  • An understanding of the inner working of WordPress

Day-to-day responsibilities include:

  • Using debugging skills to solve problems on production systems
  • Building maintainable, efficient, and clean code on Pressable's stack
  • Daily upkeep, maintenance, monitoring of Pressable's control panel
  • Providing thought leadership and direction for Pressable's development team
  • Working closely with Systems to build new features and improve Pressable's stack
  • Communicating with Pressable's leadership, and proactively looking for opportunities for improvement

Our benefits our great. You can expect:

  • Flexibility. Our team is remote, meaning you can work from anywhere you want as long as you have an internet connection.
  • Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance for less than $10. We pay 99% of premiums for you and your family.
  • 401(k) matching. We match your 401(k) contributions up to 6% of your salary.
  • A generous time off policy. We want our team members to enjoy a phenomenal work–life balance.

Let us know you’re interested!

items.title: Ionic/Angular JS Developer @ Appnovation
items.content:
Ionic/Angular JS Developer @ Appnovation

2017-11-09 00:24

Description

About Us

Appnovation, a global technology enabled services provider, specializes in the design, development and integration of enterprise-grade open technology solutions. With 10 offices and 200+ employees, Appnovation delivers to clients ranging from startups to the Fortune 500, government entities and nonprofit organizations, helping them to identify opportunities for innovation and stay competitive.

To learn more about Appnovation’s projects, awards, or culture visit www.appnovation.com.

We are seeking an Ionic/Angular JS (experience with Angular 4 preferred) developer to deliver complex apps in Ionic and on our client's platforms. Alongside project delivery, you will maintain internal reference app that demonstrates the best of Ionic and its value proposition.

This role can be done remotely.

YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO

  • Work on a number of hybrid mobile applications backed by an in-house component library to rapidly develop and deliver solutions
  • Work closely with product teams during the implementation of the mobile app
  • Work in a tight feedback loop with the product owners
  • Take requirements and make reusable / configurable components that can be used in component library.

WHO YOU ARE

  • Excellent written and verbal English
  • Confident when working with Product Owners and understanding their objectives
  • Proactive work chaser - not a “specification waiter”
  • Good experience working with remote teams
  • Experience working independently in an iterative delivery environments
  • Have an expectations setting mindset and be highly communicative
  • Be able to onboard quickly and work within team disciplines and constraints

Technical Skills required

  • Proven commercial Ionic/Angular JS development experience
  • Native or other hybrid mobile app development experience (Cordova/PhoneGap)
  • Proven commercial Ionic/Angular development experience using various flavours of JavaScript, specifically TypeScript, ES6 and ES2015
  • Excellent experience with REST APIs, JSON, NoSQL + data modelling
  • Excellent experience analyzing business and technical requirements
  • Automated testing framework experience
  • Mule/Cloudhub experience is a bonus
  • Experience with Janrain is a bonus

Thank you for your interest in a career with Appnovation Technologies!

Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Appnovation Technologies is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are treated equally.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Full-Stack Java Software Engineer @ Sonatype
items.content:
Full-Stack Java Software Engineer @ Sonatype

2017-11-09 00:10

Description

Sonatype’s mission is to enable organizations to better manage their software supply chain. We offer a series of products and services including the Nexus Repository Manager and Nexus Lifecycle Manager.

We are a remote and talented product development group and we work in small autonomous teams to create high quality products. Thousands of organizations and millions of developers use our software. If you have a passion for challenging problems, software craftsmanship, and having impact, then Sonatype is the right place for you.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Strong software engineering foundation and experience.
  • Strong development experience with the Java stack.
  • Experience building dynamic JavaScript-based web applications.
  • Experience working in an environment leveraging remote communication and collaboration tools (e.g. HipChat, Slack, video conferencing, wikis, Github, etc).
  • Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada, the United Kingdom, or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.

Desired Experience & Skills

  • Experience or knowledge of other programming languages and ecosystems is a major plus as it is relevant to the domain of our products and services (Java, Maven, C/C++, Ruby, Python, PyPI, Node.js, npm, .NET, NuGet, etc.).
  • Knowledge and experience of continuous delivery, including automated testing of various layers, containerization, automation of infrastructure provisioning and deployment, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience of relational and non-relational databases.
  • Experience developing applications deployed in Amazon Web Services.
  • Experience in an Agile development environment.
  • Experience working in a remote environment.

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world class team of employees, investors, and partners. We are proud to be recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company for 2016. With more than 120,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

We are curious and constantly innovating without fear of failure. We are attacking a huge and emerging market and seeking remarkably talented individuals to join us on our journey.

Sonatype is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada, the United Kingdom, or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.

items.title: Front-end Developer @ UpMail
items.content:
Front-end Developer @ UpMail

2017-11-08 23:59

Description

UpMail is changing the way salespeople use emails. Our recommendation engine suggests users what to say and which content to share, making it easy and accessible for everyone to increase sales performance and generate more revenue.

We’re looking for a remote Front-End Developer to lead the front-end development of our B2B SaaS product, bring UpMail to the next level and shape the sales acceleration technology industry.

Founded two years ago by a CRM and Business Intelligence specialist, UpMail has an international team that includes passionate experts in Sales, Marketing, CRM and Tech who genuinely understand the challenges facing B2B sales people in today's digital world.

This opportunity comes at an exciting point in our journey: we’ve quickly grown our client base, which now includes well-known hotel groups like Hilton, Jury’s Inn, Virgin, and Best Western.

We’ve raised more than $500k in investment and just expanded from London with new offices in Paris and the US. Recently launched commercial partnerships in Central Europe and South-East Asia. We’re now getting ready for additional international growth and truly global expansion!

This is a unique occasion to make an important impact on a funded startup with a proven business model.

Current technology stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSql, JQuery.

Requirements

  • Minimum 3yrs experience in JavaScript (and HTML/CSS).
  • Experienced with React (or VueJS/Ember).
  • Competent working in the full stack (ideally Rails).
  • Experienced in automated testing.
  • Passionate working for a fast paced start-up experience.
  • "Get it done” attitude and background of delivering great work.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Minimum 4 hours time zone overlap with UK 9am-6pm.

Desirable

  • Strong UX understanding
  • Experienced working remotely

Benefits

  • Great and open-minded company culture built by an international team with global ambitions.
  • Incredible opportunity to create meaningful, scalable and successful tech company and progress internally as we grow.
  • Competitive salary and flexible hours.
  • Remote or based in our London office.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Minimum 4 hours time zone overlap with UK 9am-6pm.

items.content:
Lead Developer (RoR) @ UpMail

2017-11-09 00:00

Description

UpMail is changing the way sales people use emails. Our recommendation engine suggests users what to say and which content to share, making it easy and accessible for everyone to increase sales performance and generate more revenue.

We're looking for an entrepreneurial, hands-on, Senior Developer to lead our B2B SaaS product engineering team, bring UpMail to the next level and shape the sales acceleration technology industry.

UpMail was launched two years ago, and now has an international team that includes web-developers, sales and customer success experts.This opportunity comes at an exciting point in our journey: we’ve quickly grown our client base, which now includes well-known hotel groups like Hilton, Jury's Inn, Virgin, and Best Western.

We've raised more than $500k in investment and just expanded from London with new offices in Paris and the US. Most recently launched commercial partnerships in Central Europe and South-East Asia. We're now getting ready for additional international growth and truly global expansion!

This position is ideal for someone already in a lead developer role who wants to continue developing his management skills and business sense in order to become a CTO. He or she will have the opportunity to plan, deliver, and own UpMail's high level B2B SaaS technology road map and architecture, while also running day-to-day operations and delivery of a rapidly evolving product.

This is a unique occasion to make an important impact on a funded startup with a proven business model.

Technology stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSql, JQuery.

Requirements

  • A commercially experienced Ruby on Rails full-stack developer with good working knowledge of backend/frontend/devops technologies.
  • Comfortable developing a technology strategy to deliver a market leading product
  • Experienced in managing remote development teams in the B2B SaaS technology industry
  • Able to understand business requirements and priority of a fast growing startup
  • Experienced building and maintaining reliable, performant, secure web apps
  • Interested and capable in proactive value adding to the business strategy to develop user focused products
  • Fast paced start-up experience
  • Good communicator
  • Work with a small high-performance team who will fight beside you to accomplish the amazing

Benefits

  • Great and open-minded company culture built by an international team with global ambitions.
  • Incredible opportunity to create meaningful, scalable and successful tech company.
  • Competitive salary, equity and flexible hours.

items.title: Backend Engineer
items.content:
Backend Engineer - Jobmote

Backend Engineer

Waldo Photos

Waldo Photos  is a photo-finding platform empowering people to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets, and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Our users can enjoy life’s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones, or share images of others they’ve taken without having to lift a finger – whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.

We're looking for an independent problem-solver who values learning, keeps current on technology trends, and enjoys the ownership and accountability that is expected from early-stage team members. The ideal candidate will:

  • enjoy coding at all layers, focusing mainly in the backend;
  • learn whatever is necessary to get the job done;
  • write clean, elegant, simple, testable code;
  • be comfortable with git, pull requests, and code reviews;
  • take pride in their work; and
  • want to work with others who do the same.

While we're based in Austin, Texas, we have team members all across the globe. We are open to  r** emote, international, contract **employees – but we do need full-time commitment.

BASE QUALIFICATIONS

  • You've been actively coding in Python or Java for at least 5 years.
  • You have excellent algorithmic and coding skills.
  • You feel comfortable in learning and eventually using each of these, as we're developing our services in them: Python, Java, Javascript, Clojure, and Go.
  • You know how to efficiently and properly design relational databases with a deep understanding of what affects query performance.
  • You know what the conceptual difference is between PostgreSQL, Cassandra or Kafka, and RabbitMQ – which by the way, we use all of these and more!
  • "I always write tests for my code" is your middle name.
  • You thrive in a small team, high autonomy environment.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • You have a proven track record of building and shipping complex, high-performance, highly-available distributed systems.
  • You have an experience with GraphQL and related libraries (i.e. Apollo, Relay).
  • You love leading and mentoring a team.

DETAILS

  • Ability to work remote from anywhere in the world
  • Flexible vacation
  • Unlimited (virtual) high fives
  • Type: Full-time
  • Annual salary: $80,000 - $100,000
  • Equity: 0.0% - 0.20%

items.title: Remote full stack designer for SaaS company
items.content:
We are looking for a full-stack designer that will help us make sure that all our websites, documents, emails, slides, videos and everything else looks consistent and beautiful. You do NOT need to do everything on your own - we completely support out-tasking and outsourcing - but you need to own the final product.

Some examples of work in the first few months: redesign of our company website, UI design of a new SaaS project, writing a design guide, designing & editing sales and tutorial videos, designing Facebook and AdWords banners, designing a company booklet and so much more.

Niteo is an international remote-only SaaS company with team members from United Kingdom, USA, Slovenia, Romania and Philippines. We have projects in the SEO space and are looking to expand to other markets. We believe in Open Source so you can read about how we work in detail in our public Handbook and on our blog.

It is our belief that the ratio of women and/or people of color in tech teams should be higher. We believe diversity has its challenges, but the benefits far outweigh them. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply for this position.

 

Why work with us?

You will be regarded as a responsible and reliable adult. We put a lot of trust in you and give you autonomy to do your job the best you can. You receive the training you need to do the job, then we set your goals and define your tasks together. After that you plan and organize yourself. You set your own work schedule. You work on days you want to and from where you want to. You tell us when you go on a vacation and for how long.

In the end you are judged on your results and how well you work with your peers. The same goes for your coworkers who are all A-players. If you need someone to always tell you what to do and how to do it, then it's best you find something else.

items.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
items.content:
Ruby on Rails Developer - Jobmote

Ruby on Rails Developer

TaxJar

_ We have an immediate opening on our product development team in the role of Ruby on Rails developer  _for someone who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs. This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US.

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 10,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. We’re passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers."

We offer TaxJar Reports , a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations. For developers, we have created an helpful API demo environment and also are fanatics about creating and maintaining great API documentation. 

As a Rails Developer on our team you will

  • Write excellent Ruby on Rails code daily.
  • Be challenged weekly to solve new problems
  • Review and test your teammates pull requests
  • Create and maintain our existing RSpec test suites
  • Maintain and update our sales tax reporting application
  • Build out apps and services for managing thousands of sales tax rules
  • Help with improving and scaling our SmartCalcs API
  • Work with Rails, Elixir, AWS, Heroku, Postgres, Sidekiq and more.
  • Help monitor and support 24/7 Rails applications and services
  • Ensuring the happiness of our more than 10,000 paying customers is everything to us. Every employee, even the CEO, spends time working the customer success inbox.
  • Read more about a day in the life at TaxJar

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2+ years production experience with: Rails 4, Postgres, Heroku, AWS, Sidekiq
  • Ability to write clear and accurate tests using RSpec/Capybara
  • Write code that is maintainable and readable by your team
  • Be accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Manage development tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for building simple and intuitive solutions for complex problems in ecommerce
  • Prior SaaS development, API development or similar app dev experience
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you're

  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable
  • Never tired of learning
  • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
  • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re all peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail
  • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

Does TaxJar Offer Any Benefits?

Heck yeah! Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of benefits that we offer all employees.

The entire team works remotely from wherever we work best for each team member. For most of us, that's home. For others, that may be a local coffee shop or a summer vacation house. The only requirement is that we're working from a place with WiFi, and we're able to get our work done.

We love being a distributed team, and are looking for new teammates who will thrive in this unique environment.

    • Never tired of learning
    • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
    • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re all peers here, no egos please)
    • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail
    • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

    Does TaxJar Offer Any Benefits?


    Heck yeah! Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of benefits that we offer all employees.

    The entire team works remotely from wherever we work best for each team member. For most of us, that's home. For others, that may be a local coffee shop or a summer vacation house. The only requirement is that we're working from a place with WiFi, and we're able to get our work done.

    We love being a distributed team, and are looking for new teammates who will thrive in this unique environment.

      Apply for this position

      Think you got what it takes? Please consider this a first interview when you apply here: https://taxjar.workable.com/j/0A94CCDDD1

items.title: Sr Software Engineer to Build Event Platform
items.content:
Sr Software Engineer to Build Event Platform - Jobmote

Sr Software Engineer to Build Event Platform

Sched

WHAT WE DO

Events are where we go to be inspired by those who've followed their dreams, learn from the people who want us to succeed, build life-long friendships and discover new opportunities.

Our goal is to help organizers succeed in building more of these unforgettable events. Thousands of events depend on Sched, like tech conferences, comic conventions, music festivals, yoga festivals, professional development days and even furry conventions. Seriously, there is an event for everything.

You'll be building something that makes a real difference to our customers. Here's actual feedback about what you'll be building:

  • I wonder what the world did before Sched...
  • Sched completely revolutionized our convention.
  • Sched is pretty fuckin' awesome.
  • Using Sched is something I actively LOOK FORWARD TO whenever we're getting ready to put on another event.

YOU ARE

  • Driven to work on something that has thousands of passionate customers — and make it even better.
  • Excited to take a critical role in building out better processes for getting things done at Sched.
  • Outstanding with communication skills and the ability to keep your team in the loop.
  • Self-motivated to take on responsibilities and meet deadlines.
  • Ready to work with a small team that has your back and will support your growth.

YOUR EXPERIENCE

  • 5+ years experience building or scaling a SaaS platform.
  • Experience leading or taking initiative in a team environment to spec and ship time-sensitive solutions.
  • Highly experienced with PHP, MySQL, HTML, JS.
  • Super comfortable working within a legacy codebase and making improvements along the way.
  • Amazing ability to solve problems independently and communicate challenges with your team.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Develop and ship improvements and new features to help event organizers run better events. Working together as a small team means you'll get to wear many different hats and have a substantial impact on our product and company success.

LOCATION

As part of Sched's remote-only team, you can work from anywhere in the world. Some of our team use the flexibility to work from home. Some of our team use it to travel. It's up to you. Our founder has lived in Airbnbs for the past 5 years.

We get together throughout the year in incredible places like Bali, Tokyo, Berlin and Mykonos, all covered by Sched. Part work, part vacation, we call them #schedcations. Want to join us?

PAY & BENEFITS

Salary is dependent on experience. Generous benefits include paying you to take vacation, conferences stipends, equipment when needed and flexible hours.

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER - SENIOR BACKEND ENGINEER - REMOTE OR ONSITE AT NUMBRS IN ZURICH, SWITZERLAND
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - SENIOR BACKEND ENGINEER - REMOTE OR ONSITE AT NUMBRS IN ZURICH, SWITZERLAND

About Numbrs: Numbrs is a customer-centric financial services company. It enables its customers to manage their existing bank accounts and personal finances and to buy any financial product from every provider at the best possible price. Numbrs is not a bank and will not become a bank. Numbrs is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland and employs over 100 people. 1.5 million bank accounts are currently managed through the app in Germany and it is the #1 bank-independent banking app on iOS and Android. For more information, please visit www.numbrs.com

About the profile: Responsibilities include but are not limited to designing, developing, deploying, supporting, monitoring and troubleshooting large scale micro-service based distributed systems with high transaction volume. Applicants are also expected to participate in after-hours work.

* a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study

* 10+ years of experience in building complex high volume distributed systems

* 5+ years in JAVA, expert level

* 3+ years in GO

* 2+ years hands on experience in Kafka, Spark, Storm and Flink

* 5+ years in distributed in memory cache system (Redis, Hazelcast, memcached,Ignite)

* 5+ years in micro services architecture and development

* 2+ years in gRPC and protocol buffers

* 5+ years experience in relational (Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL) and noSQL (Couchbase, Cassandra) storages

* 3+ years in Spring Boot framework

* excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities

* excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

* experience with encryption and cryptography standards

If you are interested in working for us, please send your resume to careers (at) centralway (dot) com Should you have any other questions, feel free to reach me at the given email address.

Regards, Selina

items.title: UI Designer with Markup Experience
items.content:
UI Designer with Markup Experience - Jobmote

UI Designer with Markup Experience

Dribbble

About Us:

Dribbble is the world’s premiere community for designers. We are a profitable and bootstrapped company helping the world’s design talent share their creations and get hired. Dribbble has grown to become the go-to resource for discovering and connecting with designers around the globe. All that said, we feel that we are just getting started.

We’re looking for a UI Designer to join our team to help us realize our vision of building the world’s best platform where anyone who wants to interact with the design community will come to: share, socialize, network, hire, advertise, or find a job they love.

Why you want to work here:

Dribbble has a passionate community and a real business model. We're pro-having-a-life and family-friendly and our culture reflects that: 40-hour work weeks, flexible schedules, and a flexible vacation policy. If you work with us, you'll find out pretty quickly that we're goofballs, but we treat our employees like grownups (in the good ways, not by making them wear khaki pants.) We're a remote team and we're spread all across the land. We get together IRL a few times a year, but mostly we enjoy each other's company over Slack and video calls. If you live in Canada or the United States, you can join the team without worrying about relocating.

About The Role:

We're looking for a UI designer with a passion for working in the design world to join our product team. This is a full-time, remote position for someone in the United States or Canada. As a UI designer, here's what you'll be focused on:- Collaborating with the product team to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience.- Executing all visual design stages from concept to final integration with engineering- Conceptualizing original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.- Creating, improving, and using wireframes, user flows, process flows and sitemaps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.- Eliciting constructive feedback and interpreting that feedback into design solutions.

About You:

The requirements for the role are that you have:

  • Great visual chops and a focus on simple, clear, responsive UI.
  • A good understanding of front end development skills, and a solid working understanding of HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Proficiency in Sketch or Figma, sketching ideas quickly and iterating.
  • Ownership: the Dribbble community will depend on you to deliver a quality experience.
  • You feel responsible for creating an excellent, end-to-end platform that supports the needs of our users.
  • Comfort with data: you know when you don't know enough to make a design decision, and you seek out answers.
  • An interest in exploration: you think about what to build now and what to build in the future.
  • A solid perspective on how users engage with online communities.
  • Made useful prototypes and wireframes (send us samples!) and experience working with style guides.
  • A way with icons or illustration.
  • 5+ years of professional UI design experience.
  • Worked remote or want to give it a shot.
  • Used Dribbble and been active in the community. That's not to say you've got to be famous, but we need someone who knows and loves (or at least likes) what we do.

We've got some truly excellent perks:

  • Work from anywhere. We are a 100% distributed team.
  • Stay healthy. Full medical and dental for you and your family.
  • Unplug. Unlimited paid-time-off.
  • Pro tools. MacBook Pro (or Air) and all the tools you need to do a great job.
  • Get your learn on. We cover books, conferences, courses… get smarter!
  • Family leave. 3 months paid maternity/paternity leave for US employees.
  • Perk up. Monthly coffee budget so you’re not just loitering at coffee shops.
  • Buff up. Gym and exercise reimbursements so that you stay fit.
  • Save up. Put pre-tax savings into a 401k or RRSP. You’ll appreciate it later.
  • Hang out. Meet up with your remote team face-to-face. Each time we’ll meet up in a different city around the world.

If you think you would enjoy working remotely on a small team that loves building products and helping designers share and find work, please consider joining us.

Please send a cover letter/statement with your application. It doesn't have to be long, but it's really important. Team fit is critical for a company of our size, so help us get to know you a bit.

items.title: PHP Entwickler (m/w) to break limits in WordPress! Liebe Herausforderungen! at Inpsyde GmbH () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Web Design, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Du bist erfahrene/r oder talentierter Webentwickler/in auf den man sich verlassen kann, kennst dich mit objekt-orientierter PHP-Programmierung aus und möchtest zusammen mit anderen Top WordPress Entwicklern anspruchsvolle WordPress-Projekte mit höchster Code-Qualität im B2B-Bereich umsetzen?

Dann kannst du dir sicherlich vorstellen unter anderem an folgenden spannenden Projekten zu arbeiten:

  • In einem mehrsprachigen WooCommerce-Shop mit Anbindung an externe Dienste wie zum Beispiel SAP Business One
  • Weiterentwicklung und Support bekannter freier Plugins (z.B. BackWPup oder MultilingualPress)
  • Gestalten/Entwickeln maßgeschneiderter hoch performanter und sicherer Plugins, Schnittstellen und Themes für unsere Kunden, Dienstleister und die Community

Dich erwartet:

  • arbeiten im Homeoffice (wir sind 100% Remote)
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • sehr erfahrene WordPress Experten und Top SE User als Kollegen
  • als WordPress VIP Partner, direkter Draht zu WooCommerce und WP Core Entwickler
  • ganz nah am Puls der neuesten WordPress-Entwicklung und Technologien
  • spannende und außergewöhnliche Projekte
  • kleines Team in einem agilen Umfeld
  • wöchentlicher Wissenaustausch und Vorträge von Kollegen in einer Videokonferenz
  • tolle Kollegen, mit denen es jeden Tag Freude macht zusammenzuarbeiten
  • Besuche und Vorträge auf WordCamps und WooConf
  • flache Hierachien und kurze Entscheidungswege

Eintrittsdatum: So schnell wie möglich. Aber bei guten Entwicklern warten wir gerne.

Klingt alles interessant für dich? Dann bewerbe dich jetzt inkl. deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen, frühestmögliches Eintrittsdatum, Link zu deinem GitHub Account damit wir uns deine Code-Qualität anschauen können!

About Inpsyde GmbH

Arbeite mit unserem tollen Team von WordPress Experten und Top Usern auf WordPress Stack Exchange zusammen. Tausche dich aus, lerne von Ihnen oder lass dich gemeinsam im Team zu Höchstleistungen verleiten.

Im Gegensatz zu gewöhnlichen Arbeitgebern arbeitest du bei uns remote an immer neuen Herausforderungen in der WordPress Welt, wo du willst – in der Nähe deiner Kaffeemaschine, im Park oder an deinem Lieblingsort. Das bedeutet auch, dass du deine Arbeitszeiten flexibel einteilen kannst.

Via Slack, Hangout und Zoom kommunizierst du mit deinen Kollegen, während du unter anderem mit deiner Hardware und deinem Lieblingskaffee deine Arbeitsumgebung selbst gestaltest.

Oder treffe dich mit Kollegen auf WordCamps, Meetups oder WooConfs weltweit um sich dort auch mit anderen Entwicklern auszutauschen oder im Auftrage der Firma Vorträge zu halten.

Entwickle WordPress Plugins oder Webseiten für internationale Firmen wie Facebook, Mercedes, Parship oder WooCommerce Erweiterungen für E-Commerce Größen wie PayPal. Aber auch für Mittelstandsunternehmen, die Webseiten oder Plugins nicht von der Stange benötigen. 

Auch beteiligst du dich an der Mitarbeit an Plugins, die wir auf wordpress.org zur Verfügung stellen, wie zum Beispiel BackWPup mit über 5 Millionen Downloads und über 600.000 aktive User.

In kleinen Teams, einem Projektleiter und direktem Draht zum Chef kannst du dich und deine Ideen wertvoll einbringen.

Bewirb dich als PHP-Entwickler/in! Viele aufregende Möglichkeiten warten auf dich!

Werde Inpsyder!

Benefits

Homeoffice und flexible Arbeitszeiten - Wir Vertrauen unserem Team!
Keine langen Anfahrtszeiten! Vom Frühstückstisch in 1 Min. am Rechner!
28 Tage Urlaub
Immer in der Nähe der Familie um die man sich jederzeit kümmern kann.
Zuhause essen wo es am besten schmeckt anstatt labriges Kantinenfutter
Wir arbeiten mit Spaß! Flache Hierachien und gegenseitiger Respekt!
Nutzung der Tools deiner Wahl!
Kostenloses Spazierengehen, um den Kopf manchmal frei zu kriegen
Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit speziellem Twist und Herausforderungen
Immer am Puls der WP-Entwicklung mit direkten Draht zu WP-Experten!

items.title: VB.NET Software Engineer
items.content:
VB.NET Software Engineer


Job Description


Do you thrive on creating software that matters? Are you passionate about your craft and enjoy working with others who feel the same?


As an innovator in the operation of family entertainment centers, we are looking for experienced VB.NET developers who would love to join an established team focused on delivering serious software for a fun business.


Requirements & Skills



  • Experience developing desktop applications using VB.NET and WinForms.

  • Experience with Entity Framework.

  • Experience with MS SQL Server.

  • Must possess a firm grasp of Object-Oriented Principles.

  • Some experience working with REST API's and/or SOAP WCF.

  • Bonus:  experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.

  • Bonus:  prior experience with Infragistics.

  • Bonus:  prior experience developing with C#.


Qualifications



  • Minimum of 5 years experience designing and implementing desktop-based software systems.

  • Authorized to work in the U.S. without a visa or other sponsorship.


Cultural Fit



  • You have a passion for writing great code with the desire to achieve and exceed goals.

  • You are personally accountable for your work and love creating value for your users.

  • You have a desire for the team to succeed above personal preferences.

  • You are extremely technical, but also have a passion to constantly learn and develop new skills.


This position offers the opportunity to work remotely up to 80% of the time, but candidates MUST reside within a reasonable drive of our business location in Roxboro, NC. 


Must be authorized to work in the United States; candidates requiring Visa sponsorship WILL NOT be considered.


Must be willing to undergo a pre-employment background check and drug screen, in accordance with local law/regulations.

items.title: Contract UX/UI Designer
items.content:
Contract UX/UI Designer - Jobmote

Contract UX/UI Designer

Create Ape

Dude... Work from home? Check!

Full autonomy. You bet!

Micro manage? Naaa ..ain't nobody got time for that.

We were going to post your average, boring job description but that just does not showcase who we are as a company ;)

Who we are:

Fun and lean design agency

What we are looking for:

UX/UI designer for full-time remote contract role. Salary is 4K a month with lots of room to grow.

Type of work:

  • Informational sites
  • Parallax sites
  • Mobile Apps
  • Complex web apps
  • Wireframing + Prototypes (Holla @ Invision yo!)

What you need to bring to the table:

  • Be able to work during our business hours (9am to 5pm PST).
  • Be available throughout the day via slack/email/etc.
  • Four or more years of UX/UI design experience and a portfolio to back it up.
  • Wizard with Sketch + Photoshop.
  • Ability to create clickable prototypes using InVision.
  • Experience with Basecamp to post and collaborate on projects.
  • Extensive experience in using UX/UI design best practices to design solutions and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
  • Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently, quickly, and intelligently.  

Big bonus if you can:

  • Have some print design chops working in Illustrator + indesign
  • Basic knowledge of front end code (HTML. CSS, etc)

If you like what you see and want to get out of that commute...holla at us with your portfolio, resume, and seriously... a funny or interesting cover page!
