items.title: Site Lead - Belfast at Chef Software () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Manager
Role: DevOps
Industry: Continuous Delivery, Governance, Risk, and Compliance, Internet Infrastructure
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Chef is building the best infrastructure automation platform on the planet.  We’re writing the rules of the cloud -- rules the world’s top engineers live, breathe and contribute to.  Our platform is used to enable hundreds of millions of people around the world to chat, fly, present, bank, game, shop, and learn. Chances are the web applications you use everyday have infrastructure built, deployed, secured and managed with our code.

As the Site Lead for the Chef Belfast Office, you will initially lead a partner engineering team responsible for designing and building the right product integrations with our Ecosystem partners. These range from the major hyperscale clouds like AWS, Microsoft sand Google to a wide range of enterprise software vendors. You will have significant impact to the future of Chef. Integration with our ecosystem partners is key to the successful adoption of Chef within an enterprise.  

As a leader, you will have significant latitude for independent judgment and decision making. Your day will consist of keeping the team’s focus on the right outcomes by removing obstacles and creating avenues for success. You will be interacting with the entire company as well as our partners, customers, and the community at large; communication plays an important part of your day to day. Your audience is very, diverse; You must be a clear thinker and effective speaker who is good at influencing others.

You will be responsible for:

  • Execution of the product vision
  • Accountable for the initiatives in the roadmap
  • Providing context and communicating direction and strategy to the team
  • Growing and managing engineering teams

As a Chef People Manager, you will manage several teams comprised of members who come from a varied set of experiences, but we all have a love and curiosity of the plumbing, software-based and otherwise, that makes the world tick.  This Site Lead will also act as the point person for the entire team in Belfast both internally and externally.

Your direct reports will be Engineering Leads and IC Engineers. As their people manager, you are responsible for the following:

  • Coaching your team and counseling those who need it
  • Providing feedback and guidance on staff’s performance
  • Actively developing, empowering, and motivating staff and managing under performers
  • Working with staff to set clear and unambiguous objectives for the team as well as individuals
  • Guiding employees through the Chef career tracks
  • Recruiting, interviewing, and selecting new Chef employees

Our team at Chef is distributed across many regions and we live and communicate in a vibrant world of text and video chat and peer review. You will also be spending time with our customers and partners in a pre-sales and post-sales capacity. You must be able to travel approximately 20% of the time to lead key discussions on Chef and Partner Integrations.

At Chef, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our products and our community to flourish. Chef is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or Veteran status.

About Chef Software

Chef is on a mission to help organizations of all sizes build on a foundation of continuous automation in their quest to deliver the best customer experiences. Chef is one of Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work companies for 2017, is the recipient of Forbes’ 2016 Tech Impact Award, and received nominations for awards, such as “Best Emerging Tech Titan” by Seattle’s Geekwire magazine and Business Insider, and Best CEO. The Chef platform enables the entire enterprise ecosystem of customers, suppliers, and solution partners to deliver changes to applications, infrastructure, and compliance in many environments.

Benefits

Unlimited PTO
100% Paid Premiums for Employees
12 Weeks of Paid Parental Leave
401(k) Match
Internet and Home Office Furniture Stipend
Remote First Engineering Department
Awesomeness

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer | React Architect at Kodify () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Entertainment
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The team at Kodify is looking for a talented Senior Frontend Web Developer / React Architect to join our remote team and bring new dynamic on board. This specific role is open to remote candidates based in the European Union (a must for us). With you on board, we’re looking to expand our team (currently 10 developers working across multiple European locations) and take our projects to a whole new level.

Key responsibilities:

  • You will help design and implement a React frontend into our applications and work closely with the development team to ensure the architecture and desired functionality is always met.
  • Your collaboration with our designers means our UI & UX are flawless.
  • You will ensure the business requirements are met and will actively advise us on possible features and technologies that could improve our applications.

Must have:

  • 3+ years of experience in React based web development
  • 1+ year of React architecture design
  • Highly skilled in both HTML & CSS
  • Excellent browser side knowledge of Javascript
  • Knowledge of browser internal rendering process
  • Experience in optimising frontend performance
  • Experience with image optimisation and lossless compression
  • TDD & BDD, and a focus on code quality
  • Experience with both desktop and mobile development

Bonus points:

  • Experience working remotely and with remote teams
  • Functional CSS
  • Experience in creating design systems, style-guides, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience in Git and JIRA
  • Experience managing high traffic and content heavy websites.
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
  • NodeJS
  • SASS
  • CDNs/cache (cloudflare, cloudfront...)

About you:

  • You’re a real team player. You love to help and find solutions together.
  • You’re a natural leader and know how to motivate a team.
  • Your sense of humor will bring a new dynamic to the team - you love to have fun while you work!
  • You can think on your feet and adapt well to fast-changing environments and priorities.
  • You love analyzing data. You’re a complexity thinker and a real problem solver.
  • You’re flexible and available when needed. You understand emergency calls can be part of the job and are aware of the challenges supporting a 24/7 environment.
  • You stay updated on industry developments and strive to improve our platform with innovative solutions
  • You are passionate about software development

About Kodify

Kodify just passed its 5th year anniversary but we're based on years of success, building and managing high-traffic websites. We have grown our websites to 6M visitors per day which comes with a challenging set of technical problems to overcome. Our success is down to Kodify’s teamwork, where each one of us plays a key role in getting us one step closer to our goals. All of this doesn’t happen without a healthy portion of fun & perks! From company BBQs on our fantastic terrace, to yearly company off-sites, we make sure to live by our motto “Work Hard, Play Harder” and balance it all out! It’s our goal to create one of the best working environments possible which allows everyone to grow and achieve their maximum potential with their individual skill sets.

What’s on offer:

  • Permanent employment contract.
  • Core hours with flexitime: work when you’re at your most creative!
  • €2000 referral bonus.
  • Training and development budget and free days to attend training/conferences/etc.
  • Latest tech equipment: choose whatever boosts your productivity!
  • Agile environment
  • 10% time for personal projects
  • Free afternoons on Fridays
  • Company Amazon book account
  • Half Day off on your Birthday
  • Personalised cake on your work anniversary.
  • Awesome offices and locations: Barcelona, Altea and Montreal!
  • Kodify on-site and off-sites, events and team activities!
  • Quarterly on-site meetings where we work and play harder!
  • Unique Kodify culture!

Anything off the list? Tell us and we might add it! 

Benefits

Competitive salary
10% time for personal projects
Private health insurance
Core hours with Flexitime
Brand new equipment on joining
Learning and development budget
Free lunches
Yearly 3 day company off-sites
Free snacks, drinks and lots of team activities!
Amazing offices in: Barcelona, Altea and Montreal!

items.title: Cloud Engineer- Zookeeper Expert at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Elastic is building out our Elastic Cloud Team focusing on Elastic as a Service. This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation.

Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This product would be built on technologies such as OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elastic Clusters.

Job Duties and Requirements

  • Develop software for our distributed systems and ES as a Service offerings.
  • Have familiarity with failures and complications related to a cloud offering
  • Help build the Found offering and work closely with the Elastic Cloud Product and Engineering Team
  • Assist in designing a scalable cloud offering working across multiple clusters

Please include a short note on why your background is a fit for this role.

Qualifications

  • CS or MS Degree in Computer Science
  • Zookeeper expertise is a must have!
  • 5+ years of object-oriented development with at least one of: Scala, Python, Java, C++, or similar
  • Experience or familiarity with Docker, OpenStack, or AWS
  • Extensive experience designing solutions for the server side of scalable cloud software applications and platforms
  • Proven ability to architect a highly distributed cloud system
  • Experience or ability to respond to operational issues
  • A self starter who with experience working across multiple technical teams and decision makers
  • Ability to work with a worldwide team in a distributed work environment

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

Job description

Salesforce Developer (4+ years of experience)

  • Deep experience in Javascript, Apex development
  • Ideal candidate has experience working with Lightning components 
  • 100% remote; also open to onsite in Brooklyn, NY
  • No sponsorship being offered

Morgan and Morgan Law Firm is hiring a 4+ year Salesforce Developer for a permanent, remote role. The client is a major end-user of Salesforce and this person will report to the head of all Technical Architecture for their SFDC instance. Additional members of the team include a Senior Salesforce Developer, several Admins and a VP of Platform. Some examples of projects queued for a developer of this nature include:

  • Development of a system for reconciling traditional media attribution
  • Working with the director of digital advertising to streamline reporting across all major channels
  • Implementing call-quality metric tracking (e.g. avg hold time, avg call duration, etc.)

A creative thinker who wants to help improve our call center and marketing processes is also a huge plus. Requirements:

  • Schedule and attend project meetings & daily stand ups
  • Experience working with external API’s (Twilio, Google Analytics, etc.)
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Maintain personal project tickets via JIRA
  • 6+ years experience development applications
  • 4+ years experience in Salesforce related development
  • Salesforce Platform Development I certification
  • Experience with configuring and integration between Salesforce and Marketing Cloud.
  • Significant experience with integrations in to and out of Salesforce including custom development Apex integrations

Preferred

  • Experience with digital advertising concepts, specifically in relation to attribution and tracking (UTM vs. Value Track, UTM components, organic vs. paid, etc.)
  • Project management experience
  • Working experience with GIT source control, GitHub, and working familiarity with development lifecycle and release management process
  • Working experience with various data loading options to Salesforce
  • Familiarity with SalesforceDX and Salesforce Packaging 2.0 initiatives.
  • Working experience with Lightning Component development
  • Salesforce Platform Development II certification

Proficiency and Certification Expectations The expectation is that the candidate, within 4 months of hiring, will achieve four out of the following certifications (if not already attained).  The expectation is within 6 months of hiring, candidate will achieve all of the following certifications:

  • Salesforce Certified Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified App Builder
  • Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Consultant
  • Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Email Specialist
  • Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Social Specialist

The expectation is that within 1 year of hiring, candidate will achieve Salesforce Platform Development II certification (if not already attained).

items.title: Software Developer - Help us see into the future! at YouGov () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Market research, Web Technology
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

You will take ownership and responsibility for IT development projects, while working in a fast paced and agile environment. Working as part of a wider development team, you’ll interact with the remote global teams along with product departments within our offices across the world.

Day to day you will provide new features to YouGov’s survey systems, collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to determine needs and plan projects, optimize features for speed, clarity and robustness, expand test coverage and troubleshoot as and when needed. You will also have an inquisitive and innovative style to ensure that you are constantly thinking of ways to challenge our current ways of working and come up with new developments and ideas.

What we expect?

You’ll already be a highly skilled professional software developer with expert knowledge (and extensive experience) with Python (2 and 3). Your tech skills will be second to none and ideally you will be used to working with MongoDB, PostgreSQL and RESTful APIs. If you’ve got some experience with HTML, javascript and CSS, this would be a great help also, along with being well versed in version control and Linux. Above all, you will be dedicated to robust test driven development and have the ability to take a project through to final completion.

What we offer

  • Exciting technology stack
  • Ability to focus and develop the skills you enjoy best
  • Global reach of your work (quick release cycle)
  • Stable employment at a global company, with a start up atmosphere
  • Fresh fruit, coffee
  • Great equipment, screen, office – we want you to be happy!

Last things?

This is a full time remote working role and can be based in remote location throughout Europe. If you prefer to be office based, this can also be arranged.

About YouGov

YouGov is an international, full service online market research organisation offering custom research, omnibus, field and tab services, qualitative research, syndicated products and market intelligence reports. 

Founded in the UK in 2000, YouGov is considered the pioneer of online market research. Our unique fully integrated online model has a well-documented and published track record illustrating the accuracy of its survey methods and in turn the quality of its client service work. We can conduct research in all continents and our online model allows clients to get international results faster and more cost-effectively than traditional methods, with no compromise on quality. YouGov has offices in the UK, US, Europe and the Middle East. 

It is our goal to understand the world you live in, the sector you operate in, and your brand, enabling us to provide you with a live stream of continuous, accurate data and insight into what people are thinking and doing all over the world. Information which not only serves in tackling current issues facing your organisation but also aims to offer a comprehensive understanding of your organisation and its place in the world we live in today. 

The group operates an online panel of over 5 million respondents worldwide representing all ages, socio-economic groups and other demographic types which allows us to create nationally representative samples online and access hard to reach groups, both consumer and professional

Benefits

Flexibility
Best Equipment
Salary + Bonus
Well-being at Work
Various lifestyle benefits
Culture of Learning
Pension (401K in the USA)
Employee Assistance
Games and Social Events
Good Holiday allowance

items.title: Senior Ruby Engineer at Kyero.com () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Advertising, Real Estate, Travel & Tourism
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The role :

Engineers at Kyero.com are constantly pushing themselves to greater heights and redefining what is possible from a small team of passionate individuals.

They share some lofty business goals that will be achieved through well defined processes and automation but most significantly, through creativity and remarkable performances from a highly collaborative team.

We believe that happiness and productivity form a virtuous feedback loop that can be optimised for the benefit of all. We do this continuously and enthusiastically!

You will be working in the engineering team on a number of Rails and plain Ruby apps with an sharp eye on performance and scalability.

What we are looking for:

  • You have in-depth knowledge of "plain old Ruby" and you know when *not* to use a feature built into Rails.
  • You check your ego at the door and enjoy receiving feedback as a way to learn and grow. You help others do this as much as possible.
  • You geek out about testing, code reviews, continuous deployment and pairing as they are guarantors of quality and shared knowledge.
  • Squeezing out those last few milliseconds of performance is a sign of a job well done.
  • You enjoy shipping code every day.

What your day will look like:

  • Quick catch up with the team to sync up and refresh your vision of the big picture.
  • Review a team mate's pull request and provide constructive feedback for them to improve their code.
  • Head down and deep dive into a complex problem, trying to find the most elegant solution.

Technical requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience working as a Senior Ruby Engineer.
  • Expert level Ruby and Rails.
  • In depth knowledge of design patterns and when to apply them (or not).
  • An understanding of what it takes to run and scale a high throughput production site in terms of cacheing, queuing and messaging. 
  • A good sense of humour or the ability to communicate one via emoji.
  • Curiosity and an eagerness to learn new skills.
  • To be geographically situated in a time zone between UTC-1 and  UTC+3.
  • Team player with clear communication skills.
  • To be comfortable and productive working 100% remotely.

Optional, but a major plus:

  • You speak great English and another language fluently.
  • Using Docker in a development environment.
  • Fullstack experience, React.js is a major plus.
  • Ability to so some basic devops on our Heroku stack. 
  • Experience with SOA and its advantages/constraints.
  • Beautiful code is like Mozart to you.

About Kyero.com

About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, System Administrator
Industry: Banking, Bitcoin, Cryptocurrency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

This is a remote position, meaning you can work from wherever you are!

Overview:

Xapo is seeking a senior Full Stack Developer to join our team. We need someone passionate willing to work with first class engineers around the world. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned developer with proven experience in backend development using python, with strong knowledge of MySQL programming and Redis. The candidate must also be able to master front end development technologies using javascript, jquery and html. Developer profile mixture is 90% backend and 10% frontend. Experience with fin-tech and trading platforms development is required.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a senior developer, you will work with a highly specialized multidisciplinary team that handles the complete development lifecycle of a product, from the envisioning phase to the production deployment. You will be mainly responsible within this team for building high quality software components that fulfill defined functional specifications and fit in the architectural designs for it. You will be responsible to work in an autonomous way following a defined plan and achieving schedule goals in time. You will also be required to participate in the design, test and deploy of your code. Excellent teamwork and good planning and communication skills are a must.

We are looking for experienced, passionate, enthusiastic and top quality engineers; if you think you have what it takes to help revolutionize the fin-tech future then come join us!

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education and/or Experience:

Outstanding engineering talent proved by great work results and experience.

Experience developing forex trading platforms and real time quotation systems.

5+ years’ experience in software development for commercial projects.

Backend development. (90% of work)

Excellent proven Python development skills.

Good development and tuning skills for MySql and Redis

Flask, uwsgi and NGINX, experience.

API building and consuming experience is desirable

Frontend development (10% of work)

Good Javascript and jquery skills

Knowledge of HTML development

CSS developing experience is desirable but not required

Platform and libraries

Feel comfortable using Linux, Docker, Flask, uWSGI and NGINX

Experience using Git, Stash, Jira, Trello

Capable of documenting and diagramming functional flows and architectures

Experience with other major development language and frameworks like, C, C++, Java or .NET, Node.js is desirable

Experience with other front end frameworks like Prototype, Undersore.js, etc is valuable but not required.

Mobile development knowledge, add points by not required

Self-motivated, with initiative and enthusiasm, willing to work hard with a remote team

Experience working by plan and objectives in autonomous mode.

Good communication skills and remote teamwork experience.

Native/Bilingual English speaker is a must. Spanish is a nice to have.

Experience within fintech and knowledge about Bitcoins would be ideal.

Some perks of working with Xapo:

  • Attractive compensation – highly competitive!
  • Stock Options Grant
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote job/working from wherever you want!
  • To join a successful startup Company growing passably

About Xapo

Xapo is a leading bitcoin wallet, and we have a mission to bring bitcoin to the everyday lives of people across the world. Our business is growing fast, and we want to make sure we can keep providing the best quality support to our customers. We’re known for our fast responses to users, positive attitude, and a real desire to find the best working solutions to the people who chose to use Xapo’s products and services.

Benefits

Competitive Compensation
Remote opportunities
Flexible hours
Equity opportunities

items.title: Perl Expert with finance/trading background (and pajama aficionado) at Collective2 LLC () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Financial Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Do you love wearing pajamas? Of course you do! Everyone loves wearing pajamas.

Do you know what's even better than wearing pajamas when sleeping? ... Wearing pajamas when working.

That's what you can do at Collective2, because we're a remote-work-only, distributed company, and we are hiring.

Who are you?

You are a Perl expert with finance and trading experience. Also, you love wearing pajamas to work.

Skills & Requirements

  • Perl expert. Yeah, no kidding. 90% of what we do server-side is Perl. Still a few of us left, and we refuse to go gently into the night.
  • Comfort with client-side Javascript/jQuery.
  • Required: deep familiarity with trading, investing, finance.
  • Ability to work remotely.

How to apply - (IMPORTANT)

Please include a cover letter or note telling us why you are right for this specific position. Please write about your level of familiarity with trading and finance. Please look at and use our web site. Do not merely send a CV or resume and call it a day. If this position sounds interesting to you, and you think you are a good fit for our company, please make an effort to tell us why.

About Collective2 LLC

Social Trading

Collective2 is a pioneer in the field of "social trading." What is social trading? Social trading takes the activity of "investing" -- which previously happened only in private, like some kind of embarrassing biological process -- and brings it out into the sunshine so that other people can watch and benefit.

On Collective2's web site, you can find traders and investors that you like and admire, and follow along with them in your own brokerage account. Alternately, if you're a good trader, you can attract followers (and earn extra money doing so).

So Collective2's business touches a lot of interesting areas: finance, trading, automation, algorithms, big-data, risk analysis.

Remote Only

Collective2 is a "distributed" company - no central office, no cubicles, no pointy-headed managers. We are a team of men and women working together, full-time, from homes and coworking facilities all over the world.

We are a small company. We try to keep things on a human (and humane) scale. No politics, no corporate B.S.

Because we are small, every software developer has tremendous responsibility. We'll keep you challenged and happy.

And finally:

Be honest with yourself. The idea of working remotely sounds appealing, but it drives some percentage of the population bat-shit crazy. If you need proximity to warm human flesh, a foosball table, or a communal water cooler, this position probably isn't for you. But if you want to live anywhere you like in the world, dream of giving up your commute, and like the idea of working from the quiet and peace of your home, it might be perfect.

Benefits

Competitive salary
Live anywhere, work anywhere
No commute!
Independent working environment
Flat structure

Gaggle was launched in 1999 and was one of the pioneering companies to provide a safe student email solution. Since then Gaggle has grown to offer so much more. About Gaggle.Net

Gaggle has been providing safe online learning products and solutions to the K-12 market since 1999. Our focus is, and always has been, on student safety so educators can have the confidence to allow learners to take advantage of current technology for communication, collaboration and learning.

items.title: FullStack Developer (Must be based in Europe) at Kodify.io () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Entertainment
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The team at Kodify is looking for a talented FullStack Developer to join our remote team. This specific role is open to remote candidates based in European Union only (a must for us). With you on board, we’re looking to expand our team (currently 7 developers working across multiple European locations) and take our projects to a whole new level. You will deliver Javascript development skills on the front and backend systems that power our sites. Good knowledge of HTML and CSS are also required, along with the ability to work with our designers and the business to implement the features required.

Your key responsibilities: 

  • Create Server and Client JS, HTML & CSS to deliver required functionality and design
  • Highly skilled in frontend templating engine using React
  • Ensure all code is modular, and where possible developed as reusable
  • End-to-end responsibility from technical design to deployment and testing
  • Work with Designers & Product Owners to ensure they understand possibilities / limitations
  • Always work towards minimising page load time & data transferred
  • Become a valued team member, providing feedback to the team
  • Take ownership of your code / tasks / role
  • Be proud of what you achieve, and of the product, and be one of the driving forces behind always making it better
  • When you cock-up - own-up! (We don’t do blame-storming here!)
  • Have fun and enjoy your job!

About you:

  • You’re a real team player. You love to help and find solutions together.
  • Your sense of humour will bring a new dynamic to the team - you love to have fun while you work!
  • You can think on your feet and adapt well to fast changing environments and priorities.
  • You are passionate about software development
  • You're able to think beyond code to architecture and user experience
  • You have a a real ‘Can Do’ work ethic - We are results based, not clock based!

Skills & Requirements

Must Have:

  • NodeJS
  • Javascript / HTML / CSS
  • React
  • MongoDB
  • Github
  • LESS / SASS
  • Bootstrap and JQuery

Bonus points:

  • Express / Connect
  • Redis
  • RequireJS
  • ZeroMQ
  • TDD
  • BusterJS / CucumberJS with WebdriverIO
  • Your own open source projects
  • DataTables

  • Streaming video technologies / Web playback tools (VideoJS)
  • Understanding of, and agreement with, Agile principles

Other:

  • Experience working remotely and with remote teams

Education is compulsory, but where you got it is irrelevant for us! We are looking for someone who has worked in a similar role (or roles) for at least 3 years, and can show us examples of their work. We are not looking for a newbie, nor are we looking for a rockstar, we are looking for a mid to senior level developer who wants to both learn and contribute to our team.

Do you like what you read and want to be part of it? Please send us your CV along with a covering letter explaining why this job is right for you, and why you are right for the job!

About Kodify.io

Kodify just passed its 5th year anniversary but we're based on years of success, building and managing high-traffic websites. We have grown our websites to 6M visitors per day which comes with a challenging set of technical problems to overcome. Our success is down to Kodify’s teamwork, where each one of us plays a key role in getting us one step closer to our goals. All of this doesn’t happen without a healthy portion of fun & perks! From company BBQs on our fantastic terrace, to yearly company off-sites, we make sure sure to live by our motto “Work Hard, Play Harder” and balance it all out! It’s our goal to create one of the best working environments possible which allows everyone to grow and achieve their maximum potential with their individual skill sets.

What’s on offer:

  • Latest tech equipment: choose whatever boosts your productivity!

  • Awesome offices and locations: Barcelona, Altea and Montreal!
  • Kodify off-sites, events and team activities!
  • Unique Kodify culture!

10% time for personal projects
Private health insurance
Core hours with Flexitime
Brand new equipment on joining
Learning and development budget
Free lunches
Yearly 3 day company off-sites
Free snacks, drinks and lots of team activities!

items.title: Software Engineer- Golang- - For Elastic Beats Product- Top Open Source Company at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Please include a short note to be considered for this position.

The Beats platform is the basis for building open source shippers that collect all kinds of operational data, store it in Elasticsearch, and visualize it with Kibana. They collect data from edge servers, and are used to power application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring, and network monitoring. We currently have five official Beats: Filebeat for gathering logs, Packetbeat for network traffic, Metricbeat for metrics, Winlogbeat for Windows event logs, Heartbeat for uptime monitoring, and Auditbeat for audit data. In addition, the open-source community has created over 40 Beats, collecting data from all sorts of sources.

All current Beats are written in Golang.

As part of the Beats team, you will be responsible for maintaining the official Beats, for creating new ones, as well as for supporting the community around Beats. The team is diverse and distributed across the world, and collaborates on daily basis over Github, Zoom, and Slack.

Your contribution

  • Define and create Metricbeat modules to collect metrics and build Kibana dashboards for monitoring various services. This implies understanding the monitored service and finding the most relevant metrics.
  • Write open source Golang code for Metricbeat
  • Work with our support team to help customers
  • Answer community questions
  • Collaborate with other development teams, quality engineering team and documentation team to execute on product deliverables

What you will bring along

  • BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related engineering discipline and 3+ years of industry experience
  • Experience with operating various services and other monitoring systems
  • Experience in Golang programming is a big plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, a great teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work in a distributed team throughout the world.
  • Knowledge and experience in Elasticsearch, Logstash, Distributed Systems is a plus.

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

items.content:
About this job

Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Kibana lets users visualize their Elasticsearch data and navigate the Elastic Stack, so they can do anything from learning why they’re getting paged at 2:00 a.m. to understanding the impact rain might have on their quarterly numbers. Kibana gives users the freedom to select the way they give craft to their data. And they don’t always have to know what they’re looking for. With its interactive visualizations, users start with one question and see where it leads them. Kibana core ships with the classics: histograms, line graphs, pie charts, sunbursts, and more. They demonstrate the full aggregation capabilities of Elasticsearch.

Are you a top Javascript developers who want to add to Kibana and X-Pack? We want to meet you!

Please include a short note as to why you are a fit for this role

Engineering Philosophy

Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed APIs is a non-trivial effort. It requires solid software development skills, and more importantly, a sharp mind and the ability to think like a user. We also care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you’re working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. At Elastic, we effectively don’t have a hierarchy to speak of. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on truly anything, regardless of his or her role within the company.

Responsibilities

  • Innovate, lead and contribute to front end and visualization experience of the Kibana and other UI products using JavaScript
  • Collaborate with other development teams, quality engineering team, and documentation team to execute on product requirement.

  • Provide feedback to the UI Team Lead
  • Work with the Team Lead to make sure the team performs well and is appropriately resourced

Skills & Requirements

  • 7+ years of front end development work
  • Experience with one modern MVC style JS Framework
  • Experience writing automated tests
  • Experience as a lead engineer on a team of three or more engineers
  • Ability to work in a dynamic start-up environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, a great teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills
  • Strong preference for operational experience, building complex data visualization and related tooling, Open Source experience.

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Job description

This is an opportunity to work on a fast growing SaaS service, with a globally distributed team, a dynamic and rapidly growing group of engineers based all around the world, covering a multitude of countries and timezones. Our Cloud service leverages technologies such as 3rd party Cloud hosting (AWS, GCP, etc.), Docker, Terraform, and others to provide the best of breed hosted Elastic Stack as a Service offering.

We're solving some very hard problems with innovative tech and have fun doing so.

To be considered, please include a short note on why you want to work at Elastic and how your background matches the role

Why you should consider working in our team

  • You will get to work with a dynamic team of globally distributed engineers.
  • You will have the opportunity to be an evangelist for Elastic products and services through blog authorship, conference speaking, and developer relations.
  • You will have the chance to become a pivotal contributor in a fast paced and high growth product team.

What you will be doing as a Cloud Engineer

  • Develop software for our distributed systems and Elastic Stack as a Service offerings
  • Participate in design and architecture discussions.
  • Be an expert in dealing with failures and complications related to a cloud offering
  • Contribute to automated testing
  • Thrive on your interest in technical outreach (blog posts, tech papers, conference speaking, etc.)
  • Be an awesome person to work with

What you will bring along

  • CS or MS Degree in Computer Science
  • 5+ years of object-oriented development with at least one of: Scala, Python, Java, C++, or similar
  • Experience or familiarity with Docker, and Cloud hosting environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)
  • Extensive experience designing solutions for the server side of scalable cloud software applications and platforms
  • Experience with developing highly distributed Cloud systems.
  • Experience or ability to respond to operational issues
  • A self starter who with experience working across multiple technical teams and decision makers
  • Ability to work with a worldwide team in a distributed work environment
  • Nice to have- experience using or developing with Zookeeper, Paxos, or Raft

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 500 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

items.title: Java Engineer - Geospatial- Leading Open Source Company- Great Work/Life Balance at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Want to work for a company that's family oriented with great work/life balance. Send us a short note as to why you are a fit along with your resume!

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Do you want to work on distributed geospatial search and analytics software which impacts the lives of millions of people? We are looking for excellent back-end Java engineers who love solving problems. We’re not interested in your previous job title. Instead, we want to collaborate with bright people with a good knowledge of Java and a desire to take on new challenges.

Our Engineering Philosophy

Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed APIs is a non-trivial effort. It requires solid software development skills, and more importantly, a sharp mind and the ability to think like a user. We also care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you’re working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. At Elastic, we effectively don’t have a hierarchy to speak of. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on absolutely anything, regardless of their role within the company

Right now, we are on the outlook for a passionate and talented geospatial Java Engineer to join our Elasticsearch team. This role can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.

These are the kinds of problems you will work on

  • Investigate and implement optimizations for geo spatial indexing and search data structures
  • Integrate new geospatial features from Lucene
  • Implement new geospatial aggregations including spatial statistics, clustering, and hot spot analysis
  • Improve existing geospatial APIs including new intercommunication formats
  • Work closely with cross product teams to expand geospatial offerings at all levels of the Elastic stack.

What you will bring along

  • Experience implementing geospatial data structures (e.g. spatial trees, tries).
  • Familiarity with exploratory spatial data analysis and spatial statistics techniques.
  • A firm understanding of geospatial coordinate systems, map projections, and datum transformations.

Do you know the answers most of these questions?

  • When would you make a variable volatile?
  • How do you decide whether to use a HashMap or a TreeMap?
  • How do you decide whether to use a CopyOnWriteArrayList or a Collections.synchronizedList(ArrayList)?
  • When would you use mergesort over quicksort?
  • When might recursion cause stack overflows?
  • Is Math.abs(Random.nextInt()) always positive?
  • What are the pros/cons of async vs. blocking I/O?
  • What unit tests would you write for Arrays.binarySearch?

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits.
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since i ts initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

items.title: Senior Mobile Engineer (Remote)
items.content:
Senior Mobile Engineer (Remote) - Jobmote

Senior Mobile Engineer (Remote)

Retail Zipline

“Terrific founders with technical and domain expertise, totally focused on customer success. Their progress in the first year is amazing.” - One of our investors

Retailers use archaic, old systems that don’t work (think fax machines and voicemails). We’re replacing the core operational processes with a modern platform that our customers love. Help us transform a $4.4 trillion industry and improve the way millions of people work. Major retailers are already using Zipline every day, but there is so much more to do!

“I think I just shed a tear. This is great!” – One of our Fortune 100 customers

We’re looking for you, our first mobile developer. There is a lot of opportunity to set a solid foundation for our mobile app and we want to bring on the right person to make that happen. You will be working closely with our design team and our engineering team to deliver a set of high quality mobile apps. We’ll help you build a team as necessary to make sure you can deliver on the goals we set together.

You get to start with a mostly clean slate. Deep understanding of at least one mobile framework is a must, and previous experience with Ruby on Rails would be a nice addition so that we can move quickly. We currently only have a simple iOS app in the app store and are actively deciding on the best way to deliver great mobile apps. You will be central to those conversations and influence the direction that we take.

We like what Basecamp has been doing to balance hybrid architecture: https://m.signalvnoise.com/basecamp-3-for-ios-hybrid-architecture-afc071589c25

You will help define our culture through hiring decisions, process design, and your personality. You don’t need to have experience with management. But, a desire to help your co-workers grow makes a world of difference.

Responsibilities

  • Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support) 
  • Produce fully functional mobile applications writing clean code 
  • Gather specific requirements and suggest solutions 
  • Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions 
  • Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance 
  • Stay up-to-date with new technology trends

Requirements

  • A preference for getting things done 
  • Proven work experience as a Mobile developer 
  • Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market 
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and Java 
  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs 
  • Familiarity with OOP design principles 
  • Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude 
  • Ability to perform in a team environment 
  • Ability to write well tested applications

Benefits

We’re a fully remote company, building a product that makes money and that people love. For a full time hire, we’re looking anywhere in the US or Canada.

Our team is small but strong and we ship things that have tangible impact. Being small, you get to impact more than the product.

We have a flexible vacation policy, full extended benefits, and a flexible work week depending on your needs. We also cover certain education costs and things you need to purchase to be able to work comfortably. In short, we all work together to make your work life great. :)

items.title: Front-end Developer
items.content:
Front-end Developer - Jobmote

Front-end Developer

X-Team

About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

We are a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. Learn more about how we can help you learn and grow at https://x-team.com/unleash/

 

About You:

The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.

 

Most important:

  • Experience with React and/or Angular

  • Experience with SASS, Webpack

  • Ability to build and improve a REST/JSON API client

  • Ability to debug API responses

  • Write high-performance, reusable code for UI components

 

Nice to have:

  • Experience with working remotely

  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

 

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated

  • Fluent in English, written and spoken

  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.

  • Proactive attitude

  • Possess a spirit of generosity

 

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.

  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.

  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.

  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to join engaging engineering roundtable discussions, AMAs, gaming clubs, LAN parties, charitable fundraisers, fitness programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you’re a remote developer.

  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth each day through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more. (http://x-team.com/unleash)

 

FAQ :

Who is X-Team meant for?

  • Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you’ve worked with freelancing platforms before, that’s not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we’ve created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they’ve ever been.

 

What are you hiring for right now?

  • We are hiring for Front-end developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We’re also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

 

Will I get a job immediately after applying?

  • If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you’re qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we’ll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

 

What kind of opportunities do you provide?

  • We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you’ve performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

Our team is small but strong and we ship things that have tangible impact. Being small, you get to impact more than the product.

We have a flexible vacation policy, full extended benefits, and a flexible work week depending on your needs. We also cover certain education costs and things you need to purchase to be able to work comfortably. In short, we all work together to make your work life great. :)

Job Perks: We have a flexible vacation policy, full extended benefits for Canadian employees, and a flexible work week depending on your needs. We also cover certain education costs and things you need to purchase to be able to work comfortably.

items.title: Full Stack Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Engineer - Jobmote

Full Stack Engineer

Waldo Photos

Waldo Photos  is a photo-finding platform empowering people to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets, and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Our users can enjoy life’s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones, or share images of others they’ve taken without having to lift a finger – whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.

We're looking for an independent problem-solver who values learning, keeps current on technology trends, and enjoys the ownership and accountability that is expected from early-stage team members. The ideal candidate will:

  • enjoy coding at all layers, focusing mainly in the backend;
  • learn whatever is necessary to get the job done;
  • write clean, elegant, simple, testable code;
  • be comfortable with git, pull requests, and code reviews;
  • take pride in their work; and
  • want to work with others who do the same.

While we're based in Austin, Texas, we have team members all across the globe. We are open to  r** emote, international, contract **employees – but we do need full-time commitment.

BASE QUALIFICATIONS

  • You've been actively coding in Python or Java for at least 5 years.
  • You have excellent algorithmic and coding skills.
  • You feel comfortable in learning and eventually using each of these, as we're developing our services in them: Python, Java, Javascript, Clojure, and Go.
  • You know how to efficiently and properly design relational databases with a deep understanding of what affects query performance.
  • You know what the conceptual difference is between PostgreSQL, Cassandra or Kafka, and RabbitMQ – which by the way, we use all of these and more!
  • "I always write tests for my code" is your middle name.
  • You thrive in a small team, high autonomy environment.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • You have a proven track record of building and shipping complex, high-performance, highly-available distributed systems.
  • You have an experience with GraphQL and related libraries (i.e. Apollo, Relay).
  • You love leading and mentoring a team.

DETAILS

  • Ability to work remote from anywhere in the world
  • Flexible vacation
  • Unlimited (virtual) high fives
  • Type: Full-time
  • Annual salary: $80,000 - $100,000
  • Equity: 0.0% - 0.20%

items.title: Front end Developer
items.content:
MUST BE BASED IN UK


We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.


Skills and experience


Essential



  • Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 2 years experience

  • Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies

  • A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, WebSockets, etc.

  • Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum

  • Working knowledge of coding best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation

  • Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment


Desirable



  • Web application user interface design skills and experience

  • Experience using Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and AWS tools and services

  • An understanding of application security and secure coding practices

  • Demonstrable passion for working with Open standards / Open Source experience


Responsibilities



  • Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery

  • Work as an integral member of a small and remote team

  • Agree and deliver on sprint commitments

  • Design and implement secure software components

  • Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases

  • Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality

  • Participate in peer review processes

  • Supporting the team through the full release cycle

  • Participate in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations

  • Supporting the test team where automation is necessary

  • To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes

items.title: Senior​ ​Mobile​ ​App​ ​Developer @ Outcomes4Me
items.content:
Senior Mobile App Developer @ Outcomes4Me

2017-11-03 02:27

Description

At Outcomes4Me, we are building an integrated platform which provides patients and theirfamilies with new ways to engage with healthcare systems globally. Our goal is to help themseamlessly discover and access personalized treatment options and outcomes information.

We recognize that the efficacy of personalized health apps is a huge issue for a relatively newsector. Increasingly, design, tech and healthcare need to work together to prove that newproducts and techniques – driven by developments in mobile – can be effective. We are verymuch aware of these issues and are bringing together a diverse and multi-disciplinary team toaddress these challenges.

We are looking for a highly experienced app developer to join our team full-time to help uscreate lasting and meaningful mobile experiences on our digital health platform.

What you have:

  • Extensive experience developing for mobile platforms
  • Fluent with modern Javascript stack: React, React Native, Flow, TypeScript, GraphQL
  • Experience with server-side development (particularly Node.js)
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies, such as Scrum / Kanban
  • Comfortable owning the app development process from design to deployment, workingclosely with product designer and manager to deliver a successful, highly polished product
  • Prior experience with either Objective-C or Swift is a plus
  • Comfortable working at a startup pace and in a rapidly changing environment

What you will do:

  • Develop and implement user-facing mobile experience and product features
  • Work alongside design and product leads to define, prioritize and develop new productfeatures
  • Work with backend teams to integrate the app with purpose built APIs
  • Own mobile app development and deliver polished working product

If you’re interested in applying technology to make healthcare better and have relevant skillsand experience, please send your resume to jobs@outcomes4me.com . We offer competitivecompensation and benefit packages, and for the right skillsets are open to remote workingconfigurations.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Backend / Chief Engineer @ Outcomes4Me
items.content:
Senior Backend / Chief Engineer @ Outcomes4Me

2017-11-03 02:25

Description

We’re looking for a senior backend /chief engineer to join our team full time, to help us create anew patient experience with the ambition to improve care. We are offering a unique opportunityto work with an experienced and passionate founding team.

Challenges we're excited about tackling:

  • Mapping and optimizing the patient experience and treatment search journey
  • Personalizing contents that addresses known and specific patient needs
  • Automatic identification of queries in patients records/profile that represent a standinginterests
  • Analyzing and modeling our search to create engaging flow
  • Empowering our users with data-informed experiences throughout their journey

We are looking for engineers with:

  • Solid engineering and coding skills
  • Experience in any of the languages Java, Python, Go
  • Experience or knowledge of Neo4j and graph algorithms
  • Experience with relational (e.g. Postgres) and Nosql (e.g. MongoDB) databases
  • Experience with cloud services/platforms (e.g., Google, Amazon) , security and HIPAAprotocols
  • Practical knowledge with agile practices, continuous software delivery, and DevOps
  • Knowledge of data processing algorithms and/or NLP is a plus

If you’re interested in applying technology to make healthcare better and have relevant skillsand experience, please send your resume to jobs@outcomes4me.com . We offer competitivecompensation and benefit packages, and for the right skill sets are open to remote workingconfigurations.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Full Stack Developer - Remote @ Flightpath Finance
items.content:
Full Stack Developer - Remote @ Flightpath Finance

2017-11-03 02:20

Description

Interested in changing the finance industry for the better?

We are building software to replace the need for a spreadsheet-based financial model. Our current clients include founders and CEOs of fast-growing SaaS companies and they use our product to make some of the most important financial decisions about their business.

We're looking for a strong, creative software engineer to work closely with the CTO and the founder. You're employee #3 and the second engineer, so your work is going to matter A LOT.

Here's what you would be doing (among plenty of other things):

  • Develop new features used by our clients to run their businesses
  • Collaborate closely with the team to plan and prioritize our roadmap
  • Design and develop tests to ensure accuracy of the presented data
  • Participate in hiring and onboarding of new engineers

Here's what we are looking for:

  • 3-5 years of professional experience as a software engineer (must have)
  • Experience as a full-stack developer (nice to have)
  • Experience with React and/or NodeJS (at least one is a must have)
  • Experience with Redux / Apollo / GraphQL (nice to have)
  • Most importantly, you are a person with high integrity, passionate about learning new things and care deeply about delighting the customer. (needless to say, this is a must have)

You'll get:

  • Competitive salary & equity package
  • Competitive vacation, and we actually want you to use those weeks to recharge
  • Freedom to work remotely from anywhere in the world
  • Annual team retreats
  • Front seat to building a business: We work with founders of fast-growing SaaS companies, and the metrics and forecasts we are building will directly help them grow their business.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Python Developer
items.content:
About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

We are a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. Learn more about how we can help you learn and grow at https://x-team.com/unleash/


About You:
The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.



Most important:

  • Experience working with Python, Django, and Javascript
  • Experience designing and deploying services on Amazon AWS
  • Experience with API based architectures (SOA, micro-services)
  • Experience writing high-quality unit tests
  • Experience with data visualisation and interpretation



    Nice to have:
  • Experience with working remotely
  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects



    Personal:
  • Independent, self-motivated
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity



    Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to join engaging engineering roundtable discussions, AMAs, gaming clubs, LAN parties, charitable fundraisers, fitness programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.
  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. (http://x-team.com/unleash)


    FAQ:

    Who is X-Team meant for?
  • Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

    What are you hiring for right now?
  • We are hiring for Python developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We're also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, PHP, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

    Will I get a job immediately after applying?
  • If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

    What kind of opportunities do you provide?
  • We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

items.title: UI Engineer @ Ambra Health
items.content:
UI Engineer @ Ambra Health

2017-11-03 02:00

Description

Ambra Health, a healthcare technology SaaS, is looking for a JavaScript developer to maintain and enhance Ambra Health’s front-end medical image sharing web application. You will report to the Director of Web Engineering. Familiarity with modern front-end web development is essential. The ideal candidate would be able to work independently with minimal supervision and be enthusiastic about keeping up-to-date with the latest web technologies. The virtual team is distributed, with team members working remotely in Boston, New York, Denver, San Antonio, and Phoenix.

Required:

  • JavaScript, HTML5, CSS
  • JQuery, Underscore
  • Working knowledge of Linux

Familiarity with any of the following would be a big plus:

  • Mustache
  • Gulp
  • DICOM
  • Selenium/Nightwatch or other web UI testing frameworks

Position Responsibilities

  • Plan, evaluate, implement, test and document new features and bug fixes for the Ambra Health web application
  • Work with other development team members to integrate with backend services
  • Work with DevOps to deploy code into our production and UAT environments
  • Work with customers and professional services to gather requirements
  • Conform to company standard operating procedures

What qualifies you to join?

  • A combination of a college degree in CS, Math or related, relevant work experience, and/or a strong open source portfolio
  • General interest in the healthcare field
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Meticulous attention to detail with strong organization skills
  • Base salary and stock options depend on experience; health insurance, paid holidays and vacation are part of the package.

Country

Anywhere
